value.def: If you study, you spend time learning about a particular subject or subjects.

example.ex: ...a relaxed and happy atmosphere that will allow you to study to your full potential...
example.tran: 能让人充分发挥学习潜质的轻松愉快的环境

example.ex: He went to Hull University, where he studied History and Economics...
example.tran: 他去了赫尔大学学习历史和经济学。

example.ex: The rehearsals make it difficult for her to study for law school exams.
example.tran: 排练使她难以专心准备法学院的考试。

value.def: Study is the activity of studying.

example.ex: ...the use of maps and visual evidence in the study of local history...
example.tran: 利用地图和图像资料研究当地历史

example.ex: She gave up her studies to have Alexander.
example.tran: 为了生亚历山大，她放弃了学业。

value.def: A study of a subject is a piece of research on it.

example.ex: Recent studies suggest that as many as 5 in 1000 new mothers are likely to have this problem.
example.tran: 最近的研究成果表明在 1000 个刚生产完的妈妈中，有 5 个可能存在这样的问题。

example.ex: ...the first study of English children's attitudes.
example.tran: 首个关于英国儿童观念的研究

value.def: You can refer to educational subjects or courses that contain several elements as studies of a particular kind.

example.ex: ...a new centre for Islamic studies...
example.tran: 新的伊斯兰教研究中心

example.ex: She is currently doing a business studies course at Leeds.
example.tran: 她目前在利兹大学修读一门商科课程。

value.def: If you study something, you look at it or watch it very carefully, in order to find something out.

example.ex: Debbie studied her friend's face for a moment.
example.tran: 黛比仔细端详了一会她朋友的脸。

value.def: If you study something, you consider it or observe it carefully in order to be able to understand it fully.

example.ex: I know that you've been studying chimpanzees for thirty years now...
example.tran: 我知道你研究黑猩猩至今已有30年了。

example.ex: I invite every citizen to carefully study the document.
example.tran: 我请每位市民都仔细研读该文件。

value.def: A study by an artist is a drawing which is done in preparation for a larger picture.
A study is a room in a house which is used for reading, writing, and studying.

example: he made several studies before starting to paint
he knocked lightly on the closed door of the study
tr: a room used for reading and writing and studying

example: she is in a deep study
tr: a state of deep mental absorption

example: mastering a second language requires a lot of work
no schools offer graduate study in interior design
tr: applying the mind to learning and understanding a subject (especially by reading)

example: after much cogitation he rejected the offer
in what discipline is his doctorate?
teachers should be well trained in their subject
anthropology is the study of human beings

tr: a composition intended to develop one aspect of the performer's technique

example: this accords with the recent study by Hill and Dale
tr: a written document describing the findings of some individual or group
someone who memorizes quickly and easily (as the lines for a part in a play)

example: She is reading for the bar exam
tr: be a student of a certain subject

example: He is studying geology in his room
I have an exam next wee
tr: I must hit the books now"
be enrolled at an institute of learning

example: analyze the evidence in a criminal trial
tr: consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning

example: He is meditating in his study
tr: think intently and at length, as for spiritual purposes

data.enText: The group will study how the region coped with the loss of thousands of jobs.

data.text: examine ♦ review ♦ study ♦ take stock ♦ survey

data.chText: 以上各词均含思量、审查、调查、研究之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to think about, study or describe sb/sth carefully, especially in order to understand them, form an opinion of them or make a decision about them.
examine
to think about, study or describe an idea, subject or piece of work very carefully

data.chText: 这些观点将在第10章作更为详细的探讨。
data.enText: These ideas will be examined in more detail in Chapter 10.
review

data.chText: 指复查、检讨，以进行必要的修改：
data.enText: to examine sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes

data.chText: 政府将在今年晚些时候重新检讨形势。
data.enText: The government will review the situation later in the year.
study
to examine sb/sth in order to understand them or it

data.chText: 我们将认真研究这份报告，然后再作决定。
data.enText: We will study the report carefully before making a decision.

data.chText: 为理解或帮助别人理解某事，如在书中探讨，用examine；为使自己理解某事，用study。
data.enText: You examine sth in order to understand it or to help other people understand it, for example by describing it in a book; you study sth in order to understand it yourself.
examine or study?
take stock (of sth)

data.chText: 指对情况加以总结、作出评估、进行反思：
data.enText: to think carefully about the way in which a particular situation is developing in order to decide what to do next

data.chText: 他该从旁观者的角度来反思一下自己的职业生涯了。
data.enText: It was time to stand back and take stock of his career.
survey

data.chText: 指总体研究、全面评述、概述：
data.enText: to examine and give a general description of sth

data.chText: 本章对欧洲政治的现状作了简略概述。
data.enText: This chapter briefly surveys the current state of European politics.
to examine/review/study/take stock of/survey what/how/whether…
to examine/review/study/take stock of/survey the situation
to examine/review/study/survey the evidence
to examine/review/study/take stock of/survey sth briefly/regularly
to examine/review/study sth carefully/systematically/thoroughly/fully/further
to examine/review/study sth closely/in depth/in detail

synonyms.bx: 通常指通过学习、练习或由别人教授以获得某种知识或技能，侧重学习的成果。

ex.chText: 你最好趁年轻学一门手艺。
ex.enText: You'd better learn a trade while you are young.

ex.chText: 我们必须互相学习。
ex.enText: We must learn from each other.

ex.chText: 我在学习滑冰。
ex.enText: I am learning to skate.

synonyms.bx: 指花费时间阅读、上课等以学习学科知识，侧重学习的过程；也指仔细观察以研究某事物。

ex.chText: 音乐老这么放着，我没法学习。
ex.enText: I can't study with the music playing all the time.

ex.chText: 他努力学习，终于学会了这种语言。
ex.enText: He studied hard and finally learned the language.

ex.chText: 物理学家正在研究宇宙射线。
ex.enText: Physicists are now studying cosmic rays.

伦敦

value.def: A big person or thing is large in physical size.

example.ex: Australia's a big country...
example.tran: 澳大利亚是个幅员辽阔的国家。

example.ex: Her husband was a big man...
example.tran: 她丈夫是个大块头。

example.ex: The car was too big to fit into our garage.
example.tran: 这部车太大了，我们的车库放不下。

value.def: Something that is big consists of many people or things.

example.ex: The crowd included a big contingent from Ipswich.
example.tran: 人群中有来自伊普斯威奇的一个人数众多的代表团。

example.ex: ...the big backlog of applications.
example.tran: 大量积压的申请表

value.def: If you describe something such as a problem, increase, or change as a big one, you mean it is great in degree, extent, or importance.

example.ex: Her problem was just too big for her to tackle on her own...
example.tran: 她的问题太严重了，光靠她自己是没法解决的。

example.ex: There could soon be a big increase in unemployment.
example.tran: 失业人数可能很快就会出现大幅增长。

value.tran: 严重的；重大的；大幅度的

value.def: A big organization employs many people and has many customers.

example.ex: Exchange is largely controlled by big banks.
example.tran: 货币兑换业务主要由大银行控制。

example.ex: ...one of the biggest companies in Italy.
example.tran: 意大利最大的公司之一

value.def: If you say that someone is big in a particular organization, activity, or place, you mean that they have a lot of influence or authority in it.

example.ex: Their father was very big in the army...
example.tran: 他们的父亲在军中很有影响力。

example.ex: I'm sure all the big names will come to the club.
example.tran: 我相信所有的大人物都会到这个俱乐部来。

value.def: If you call someone a big bully or a big coward, you are emphasizing your disapproval of them.
value.tran: （强调厌恶之深）十足的，突出的

value.def: Children often refer to their older brother or sister as their big brother or sister.
Capital letters are sometimes referred to as big letters.

example.ex: ...a big letter J.
example.tran: 大写字母J

value.def: Big words are long or rare words which have meanings that are difficult to understand.

example.ex: They use a lot of big words.
example.tran: 他们使用很多生僻的词汇。

value.boxu_tran: big, large 和 great 都可以用来表示大小。总的来说，large 比 big 更为正式，great 又比 large 更正式。big 和 large 一般用来形容物体，但是 big 也可以表示某物重要或令人印象深刻：his influence over the big advertisers（他对大广告客户的影响力）。great 通常用来强调某人或某物的重要性：the great English architect, Inigo Jones（英国伟大的建筑师伊尼戈·琼斯）。但是 great 也可以用来表示某物因为巨大而令人印象深刻：The great bird of prey was a dark smudge against the sun （逆着太阳望去，那只巨大的猛禽呈一团黑影）。large 和 great 可以用来形容数量，而 big 则不可以：a large amount of blood on the floor（地板上的一大摊血），the coming of tourists in great numbers（大量涌来的游客）。big 和 great 都可以用来强调强烈程度，但 great 更加正式：It gives me great pleasure to welcome you（很荣幸能迎接您的到来），Most of them act like big fools（他们中多数人都表现得跟大傻瓜似的）。注意 great 还有其他意义，不仅用来描述大小，还可以用来表示某物不同寻常、出色或令人愉快。
value.boxu_usage: Big, large, and great are all used to talk about size. In general, large is more formal than big, and great is more formal than large. Big and large are normally used to describe objects, but you can also use big to suggest that something is important or impressive. ...his influence over the big advertisers. You normally use great to emphasize the importance of someone or something. ...the great English architect, Inigo Jones. However, you can also use great to suggest that something is impressive because of its size. The great bird of prey was a dark smudge against the sun. You can use large or great, but not big, to describe amounts. ...a large amount of blood on the floor. ...the coming of tourists in great numbers. Both big and great can be used to emphasize the intensity of something, although great is more formal. It gives me great pleasure to welcome you... Most of them act like big fools. Remember that great has several other meanings, when it does not refer to size, but to something that is remarkable, very good, or enjoyable.

value.def: If you make it big, you become successful or famous.

example.ex: We're not just looking at making it big in the UK, we want to be big internationally.
example.tran: 我们不仅想在英国取得成功，还想在国际上扬名立万。

value.def: If you think big, you make plans on a large scale, often using a lot of time, effort, or money.

example.ex: Maybe we're not thinking big enough.
example.tran: 也许我们的抱负还不够远大。

value.def: If something is happening in a big way, it is happening on a large scale.

example.ex: I think boxing will take off in a big way here.
example.tran: 我想拳击运动在这儿会有很大的发展。

example: a big figure in the movement
he's very large in financial circles
Saturday's child is loving and giving
a liberal backer of the arts
a heart big enough to hold no grudges
that's very big of you to be so forgiving
graduation was a big day in his life
set out for the big city
tr: above average in size or number or quantity or magnitude or extent

example: the play failed big at the box office

data.chText: 这些形容词常与下列名词连用：
data.enText: These adjectives are frequently used with the following nouns.

data.chText: large较big正式，应该用于书面语，但非正式语体除外。该词通常不用以指人，除非是为了避免使用fat（胖）。
data.enText: Large is more formal than big and should be used in writing unless it is in an informal style. It is not usually used to describe people, except to avoid saying ‘fat’.

data.chText: great不仅指大，还常含伟大之意。另注意下列短语的用法：
data.enText: Great often suggests quality and not just size. Note also the phrases
a large amount of
a large number of
a large quantity of
a great deal of
in great detail
a person of great age

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，主要形容面积、体积、范围之大，可与 large 换用，但更为通俗；形容人的时候，既可指身材高大，又可以表示职位、等级和辈分很高。

ex.chText: 箱子太大了，搬不动。
ex.enText: The box is too big/large to carry.

ex.chText: 那个警察是个大块头。
ex.enText: That police officer is a big man.

ex.chText: 几位娱乐界要人来到了演播室。
ex.enText: Several big men in the entertainment industry came into the studio.

synonyms.bx: 形容某物体积大而笨重，难以携带或存放；也可指人又高又胖的。

ex.chText: 你最好不要带那件笨重的行李。
ex.enText: You'd better not take that bulky piece of luggage.

ex.chText: 他是个大胖子。
ex.enText: He is a bulky man.

synonyms.bx: 表示体积、尺寸、程度等大于一般的，相当于 very big。

ex.chText: 沿路有很多高大的白杨树。
ex.enText: There are great white poplars along the road.

ex.chText: 他们会处于极大的危险之中。
ex.enText: They could be in great danger.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，主要用于形容面积、体积、数量、重量；指人时表示身材高大的。

ex.chText: 在那个国家，我们基本没看到大树。
ex.enText: We rarely see large trees in that country.

ex.chText: 总数将相当可观。
ex.enText: It'll add up to a large amount.

ex.chText: 这个孩子个头很大。
ex.enText: He's a very large child.

data.enText: be/get too big for your boots
to be/become too proud of yourself; to behave as if you are more important than you really are
a big cheese
an important and powerful person, especially in an organization
big deal!
used to say that you are not impressed by sth

data.chText: 他不就是比我多赚点钱，有什么了不起的！
data.enText: So he earns more than me. Big deal!
the big enchilada
the most important person or thing
a big fish (in a small pond)
an important person (in a small community)
a big girl's blouse

data.chText: 懦弱的男人；胆小不自信的男人
data.enText: a weak man, who is not brave or confident
a big noise/shot/name
an important person
the big picture
the situation as a whole

data.chText: 现在别管细节问题，先通观全局。
data.enText: Right now forget the details and take a look at the big picture.
the big stick

data.chText: 大棒政策（以武力或权力相威胁）
data.enText: the use or threat of force or power

data.chText: 当权者平心静气地劝说，而不是施加压力。
data.enText: The authorities used quiet persuasion instead of the big stick.
the big three, four, etc.

data.chText: 三（或四等）强；前三个（或四个等）首要的国家（或人物、公司等）
data.enText: the three, four, etc. most important countries, people, companies, etc.
She works for one of the Big Six.
give sb/get a big hand

data.chText: 给某人 / 受到鼓掌喝彩
data.enText: to show your approval of sb by clapping your hands; to be applauded in this way

data.chText: 女士们、先生们，让我们以热烈的掌声欢迎今晚的特邀嘉宾…
data.enText: Ladies and gentlemen, let's give a big hand to our special guests tonight…
have a big mouth
to be bad at keeping secrets
to talk too much, especially about your own abilities and achievements
me and my big mouth

data.chText: 我真多嘴；真不该说出来
data.enText: used when you realize that you have said sth that you should not have said
no big deal

data.chText: 没什么大不了；无所谓；没关系
data.enText: used to say that sth is not important or not a problem
If I don't win it's no big deal.
sb's eyes are bigger than their stomach

data.chText: （表示贪吃）眼大肚皮小，眼馋肚饱
data.enText: used to say that sb has been greedy by taking more food than they can eat
have bigger/other fish to fry

data.chText: 还有更重要的事情要做；另有他图
data.enText: to have more important or more interesting things to do
make a (big) thing of/about sth

data.chText: 小题大做；大惊小怪；故弄玄虚
data.enText: to make sth seem more important than it really is
in a big/small way
on a large/small scale

data.chText: 新的递送服务迅速走红。
data.enText: The new delivery service has taken off in a big way.

data.chText: 许多人都在小量地向证券市场投资。
data.enText: Many people are investing in a small way in the stock market.
go over big (with sb)
to make a good impression on sb; to be successful

data.chText: 这个故事我的孩子们非常喜欢。
data.enText: This story went over big with my kids.
make it big
to be very successful

data.chText: 他正期待着在电视上干出个名堂来。
data.enText: He's hoping to make it big on TV.
hit (it) big
to be very successful
The band has hit big in the US.
big sb/sth↔up
to praise or recommend sb/sth strongly

data.chText: 他在电台广播节目中一直极力推荐这张CD。
data.enText: He's been bigging up the CD on his radio show.

trans: 相接双星；密接双星；密接联星；密双星
菲尼克斯；菲尼克斯电气；菲尼克斯集团；菲尼克斯连接器
接触力学
接触式麦克风；接触性麦克风
联系人；联络姓名；联系人姓名
重合度；接触比；触球率；齿轮之接触率；接触率
后接点；静合接点；闭合固定接点
联系我们
与…有交往
保持联系;有联系
联系方式；联系信息；联络资料
眼神接触；目光交流
密切接触；紧密联系；紧密接触；密集接触；亲密接触
近战；直接接触；直接接触电击；直接接觸；孤胆拯救
接触（交会，啮合）角
接通电流；接触；接通电路；闭合（闭路）接点
接触面
应力；接触应力；触应力；接触压力

value.def: Contact involves meeting or communicating with someone, especially regularly.

gramarinfo.label: also N in pl, oft N <l>with/between</l> n

example.ex: Opposition leaders are denying any contact with the government in Kabul...
example.tran: 反对派领袖否认与喀布尔政府有任何联系。

example.ex: He forbade contacts between directors and executives outside his presence.
example.tran: 他禁止董事与管理层绕开他私下进行任何联系。

value.def: If you are in contact with someone, you regularly meet them or communicate with them.

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link PHR, oft PHR <l>with</l> n

example.ex: He was in direct contact with the kidnappers...
example.tran: 他与绑架者有直接联系。

example.ex: We do keep in contact.
example.tran: 我们确实保持着联系。

value.def: If you contact someone, you telephone them, write to them, or go to see them in order to tell or ask them something.

example.ex: Contact the Tourist Information Bureau for further details...
example.tran: 详情请洽旅游信息处。

example.ex: When she first contacted me Frances was upset.
example.tran: 弗朗西丝第一次与我联系时很心烦意乱。

value.def: Your contact details or number are information such as a telephone number where you can be contacted.

example.ex: You must leave your full name and contact details when you phone.
example.tran: 打电话时须留下全名与联络信息。

value.tran: (信息、电话号码等)供联系的，供联络的

value.def: If you come into contact with someone or something, you meet that person or thing in the course of your work or other activities.

example.ex: Doctors I came into contact with voiced their concern...
example.tran: 我接触到的医生都表示了他们的担心。

example.ex: The college has brought me into contact with western ideas.
example.tran: 上大学使我接触了西方的思想。

value.def: If you make contact with someone, you find out where they are and talk or write to them.

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, PHR <l>with</l> n, pl-n V

example.ex: Then, after she had become famous, he tried to make contact with her.
example.tran: 后来，她出名之后，他曾试图与她联系。

value.def: If you lose contact with someone who you have been friendly with, you no longer see them, speak to them, or write to them.

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, PHR <l>with</l> n, pl-n V

example.ex: Though they all live nearby, I lost contact with them really quickly...
example.tran: 虽然他们都住在附近，但我很快与他们失去了联系。

example.ex: Mother and son lost contact when Nicholas was in his early twenties.
example.tran: 尼古拉斯20岁出头的时候母子就失去了联系。

value.tran: 与…失去联系;与…断了联系

value.def: When people or things are in contact, they are touching each other.

example.ex: They compared how these organisms behaved when left in contact with different materials...
example.tran: 他们比较了与不同材料接触时这些生物体的反应。

example.ex: The cry occurs when air is brought into contact with the baby's larynx...
example.tran: 婴儿的喉咙接触到空气时，就会哭出来。

example.ex: There was no physical contact, nor did I want any...
example.tran: 没有身体接触，我也不想有任何接触。

example.ex: This shows where the foot and shoe are in contact.
example.tran: 这显示了脚和鞋接触的地方。

value.def: Radio contact is communication by means of radio.

example.ex: He failed to make radio contact.
example.tran: 他未能进行无线电联络。

example.ex: ...a technical problem reported by the pilot moments before he lost contact with the control tower.
example.tran: 飞行员与控制塔失去联络前不久报告的技术故障

value.def: A contact is someone you know in an organization or profession who helps you or gives you information.

example.ex: Their contact in the United States Embassy was called Phil.
example.tran: 他们在美国大使馆的熟人叫菲尔。

example: they claimed that they had been in contact with extraterrestrial beings
her fingers came in contact with the light switch
they forget to solder the contacts
tr: (electronics) a junction where things (as two electrical conductors) touch or are in physical contact
a thin curved glass or plastic lens designed to fit over the cornea in order to correct vision or to deliver medication

example: he provided a liaison with the guerrillas
tr: a channel for communication between groups

example: the pilot made contact with the base
he got in touch with his colleagues
contact with the pier scraped paint from the hull
tr: the physical coming together of two or more things

example: he used his business contacts to get an introduction to the governor
tr: a person who is in a position to give you special assistance

example: litmus paper turns red on contact with an acid
tr: the state or condition of touching or of being in immediate proximity

example: He never contacted his children after he emigrated to Australia
tr: be in or establish communication with

example: The wire must not contact the metal cover
The surfaces contact at this point
tr: be in direct physical contact with

data.enText: act of communicating
the act of communicating with sb, especially regularly
I don't have much contact with my uncle.

data.chText: 这两个机构相互之间没有什么联系。
data.enText: There is little contact between the two organizations.

data.chText: 你和你大学里的朋友还保持联系吗？
data.enText: Have you kept in contact with any of your friends from college (= do you still see them or speak or write to them) ?
She's lost contact with (= no longer sees or writes to) her son.

data.chText: 我最终在巴黎与她取得了联系。
data.enText: I finally made contact with (= succeeded in speaking to or meeting) her in Paris.

data.chText: 这家机构为我提供了其他和我情况相似的人的联系方法。
data.enText: The organization put me in contact with other people in a similar position (= gave me their addresses or telephone numbers) .

data.chText: 避免目光相遇的两个人
data.enText: two people avoiding eye contact (= avoiding looking directly at each other)

data.chText: 这是我外出时的联系电话。
data.enText: Here's my contact number (= temporary telephone number) while I'm away.
touching sb/sth
the state of touching sth

data.chText: 他的手指稍稍地接触了一下球。
data.enText: His fingers were briefly in contact with the ball.

data.chText: 这种物质切莫与食物接触。
data.enText: This substance should not come into contact with food.
a fear of physical contact

data.chText: 这种杀虫剂昆虫一触即死。
data.enText: This pesticide kills insects on contact (= as soon as it touches them) .
meeting sb/sth

data.chText: 遇见（某人）；碰上（要处理的事）
data.enText: the state of meeting sb or having to deal with sth

data.chText: 她在工作中常与律师接触。
data.enText: In her job she often comes into contact with (= meets) lawyers.

data.chText: 儿童应该在幼年接触诗歌。
data.enText: Children should be brought into contact with poetry at an early age.
relationship
an occasion on which you meet or communicate with sb; a relationship with sb

data.chText: 我们与当地社区关系甚好。
data.enText: We have good contacts with the local community.

data.chText: 这家公司和印度一直保持着贸易往来。
data.enText: The company has maintained trade contacts with India.
person
a person that you know, especially sb who can be helpful to you in your work

data.chText: 社会上的 / 私下的熟人
data.enText: social/personal contacts

data.chText: 我在新闻界结交了一些有用的人。
data.enText: I've made some useful contacts in journalism.
electrical
an electrical connection

data.chText: 这些开关可接通形成闭合电路。
data.enText: The switches close the contacts and complete the circuit.
for eyes
medical
a person who may be infectious because he or she has recently been near to sb with a contagious disease
point of contact
a place where you go or a person that you speak to when you are dealing with an organization

data.chText: 多数人与诊所接触的第一个人是接待员。
data.enText: The receptionist is the first point of contact most people have with the clinic.

data.chText: 联系，联络（如用电话或信件）
data.enText: to communicate with sb, for example by telephone or letter

data.chText: 我整天一直在设法与你联系。
data.enText: I've been trying to contact you all day.

simple_means.memory_skill: con- 共同,一起 + tact 摸

means: <主美>（有影响的）熟人，有用的社会关系
（与…）接触(或交往)；（与…）(建立)联系，（与…）取得联系
(信息、电话号码等)供联系的，供联络的

synonyms.bx: 指用话语、信号、文字、电子设备等与他人交换信息、表达想法或情感的行为或过程。

ex.chText: 关于这问题，她正在和他交换意见。
ex.enText: She is in communication with him on this issue.

ex.chText: 在一个庞大的组织中，良好的沟通至关重要。
ex.enText: Good communication is vital in a huge organization.

synonyms.bx: 指与某人或某物之间非言语的情感交流。

ex.chText: 祈祷被视为与上帝进行交流的一种方式。
ex.enText: Prayer is regarded as a form of communion with God.

ex.chText: 他深感自己与大自然是息息相通的。
ex.enText: He had a great feeling of the communion between himself and nature.

synonyms.bx: 指人、机构、国家等之间的联系，强调接触。

ex.chText: 这两个部落间几乎没什么交往。
ex.enText: There's hardly any contact between the two tribes.

ex.chText: 他们用电子邮件保持联系。
ex.enText: They stay in contact by email.

data.enText: point of contact
a place where you go or a person that you speak to when you are dealing with an organization

data.chText: 多数人与诊所接触的第一个人是接待员。
data.enText: The receptionist is the first point of contact most people have with the clinic.
